title: (x) Looking for fat, confident fonts with rounded edges - various {gang}
content:
I'm looking for fat, confident fonts with rounded edges, like the one attached that would be good for stacking etc…

Any ideas folk? What is that one attatched?

Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20101101030815/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_70.png) | 20.99 KB |
author: stephen_k

comments.content: [The Imbiss Package](http://web.archive.org/web/20101101030815/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/imbisspackage.asp), [Neo Tech](http://web.archive.org/web/20101101030815/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/neo_tech/)/ [Neo Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20101101030815/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/neo_sans/) and [Cachet](http://web.archive.org/web/20101101030815/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/cachet/) might do fine. There's more though.

CR2 is your sample. Hermes is good too.

[http://www.identifont.com/similar?ID3](http://web.archive.org/web/20101101030815/http:/www.identifont.com/similar?ID3 "http://www.identifont.com/similar?ID3")

Sansa Soft by OurType, [http://www.outype.be](http://web.archive.org/web/20101101030815/http:/www.outype.be/ "http://www.outype.be")  
Notes Soft by PrimeType, [http://www.primetype.com/faces\_info.php?fid=34](http://web.archive.org/web/20101101030815/http:/www.primetype.com/faces_info.php?fid=34 "http://www.primetype.com/faces\_info.php?fid=34")
And from the 'old school' dept, Berlin Sans, Serif Gothic, Avante Garde and, of course, Futura all stack brilliantly in upper case
Thanks everyone for the replies – very handy indeed!
